TopicTitle: Honestly, I'm just sick of JEb

Articles.Content:
I know, he has developed a whole meme, but the reason that there are these "Jeb" memes is that every launch defaults to having him on board. And frankly, it's starting to annoy me. He is always flying the dang rockets!

It's gotten to the point where I will scrub a launch if I realize he's in the capsule.Technically you can replace him in the launch manifest, but due to some kind of a bug, you have to do that every time you launch. If you replace him once, he'll just come back later, like a bad penny.

I shouldn't care, he's just a Kerbal, but... I'm sick of Jeb hogging all the glory! There are a lot of other Kerbals that deserve their moment in the sun! Or the Kerbol!
Kill him. I killed bill and Bob by accident. It is possible. I think they died in a space plane crash and I just carried on thinking they would magically come back, but they didn't. :'(

There is a solution. One way mission. Give Jeb a base, or send him off on a long term job. (Or, park him next to the launchpad, where he can watch everything but not participate, for maximum evils.)

Edited September 17, 2014 by Tw1
Ship Manifest allows you to add/remove crew from a vessel at the launchpad without scrubbing launches.

Delete him from the persistence file, kill him (preferably with permadeath on), exile him anywhere that isn't right on the runway/launchpad. All accomplish your goal nicely.

Or, if you're up for more of a roleplay dynamic, get FinalFrontier and just pick your crew before every launch based on what they've already accomplished.

There is a solution. One way mission. Give Jeb a base, or send him off on a long term job. (Or, park him next to the launchpad, where he can watch everything but not participate, for maximum evils.)

This is what I have done. Jeb is on a small base, enjoying the scenery and the peace and quiet. On Ike.
IIRC there is a whole thread on here about "Where is your Jeb?"
Bob rather than Jeb, but this works just as well for any of the Kerman brothers: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/87491-Farewell-to-Bob

Or, if you're up for more of a roleplay dynamic, get FinalFrontier and just pick your crew before every launch based on what they've already accomplished.

That's what I would do. I should probably get around to installing Final Frontier. The way I usually circumvent the Jeb Problem is that I run multiple missions at a time. Thus, many Kerbals get to fly to space, not just Jeb, Bill and Bob.

Build a car, drive them to VAB, have them climb to the VAB roof, and let them stand there to watch for your launches.

PS: My way. Build a rocket and crash at the VAB roof. Make sure they survive and ... well, let them stand there.
Just have him EVA during an interplanetary burn. And if you don't want to spare the seat in the capsule, just mount a seat on the side of your vessel.
I usually send my Jeb, Bill, and Bob to an orbital station once I have the tech to build one.

Even tho others already said it, It's quite obvious you can just leave him out in the cold dark lonely space, and never worry about him ever again. I left Jeb somewhere on Duna, not sure exactly where, well... who cares anyway?

I put my jeb into the lab on my space station.

Bang, problem solved. Never seen him again.

I have an rover with two hitchiker modules I stuff with unwanted kerbals and drive behind the hangar, rover is named work program.

It has one use, to be used as target then landing spaceplanes, then you is 4 km away you should not be more than 1500 meter up,
I wonder if regex's RandomCrew mod is still around now that he's not actively modding. That little plugin would, as the name implies, assign a random crew to each mission.

Would be nice if crew were just randomized based on who is available at the complex. So you might get Jeb, or one of the guys you just rescued from orbit.
After using them for the first few missions or so, sometimes I build a nice big "pleasure yacht" offshore and put Jeb, Bill, and Bob in it to "retire". Just a suggestion.

I made a mobile "dunce box" rover, all my astronauts with a stupidity level above a certain threshhold get placed in it, it sits in front of the astronaut complex to shame them.

This is mainly for the unwanted recruit from rescues in orbit.

It is possible to choose craw in VAB just before launch. I use typically one of three orange guys as boss of mission and choose white guys to other positions (just rolegaming). Sometimes I change all names to finnish ones but then I loose orange suits.
The stupid ones are less demanding when running with Snacks Life Support, since they forget to eat their snacks. This makes the little, green idiots very useful to me.

Yeah, I have Jeb hang out on a space station until he's needed to command some particularly important mission.

I go to great lengths to avoid the death of any Kerbal -- especially since adding life support and turning permadeath on. The ones who die despite my best efforts tend to get grandiose memorials (such as Bill Kerman Station, a 20-kerbal OKS space station in orbit around the Mun).
